term.title: atom-bond polarizability

item.text: A quantity used in perturbation HMO theory as a measure of the change in electron density, q, of atom m caused by a change in the resonance integral, β, of bond r s:

item.alttext: π m,rs = ∂ q m ∂ β rs

sources.item: PAC, 1999, 71, 1919. 'Glossary of terms used in theoretical organic chemistry' on page 1924 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199971101919)
